reviewText: Sinatra has a vast body of filmed works.  It is curious how these major stars boxsets are put together.Manchurian Candidate and Guys & Dolls are great but had been availablein DVD for a long time.Pride and Passion is not a good film, especially for Sinatra in an embarassing role as a Spaniard.A Hole in the Head is a gem and joy to watch, by the great Frank Capra.Kings Go Forth is a soapy war film.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This box set of some of Frank Sinatra movies is worth having. The Manchurian Candidate remains a classic and Guys and Dolls, A Hole in The Head and Kings Go Forth are also good entertainment. The Pride and The Passion was a little slow.

reviewText: Another great collection. Hole in the Head is probably the weakest. But all in all very enjoyable grouping.
summary: Sinatra comes in to his own
Title: N/A

reviewText: A mixed bag of Sinatra films - with overall good transfers.Guys and Dolls (an original hit and an M-G-M release) is excellent in original 2.55 and 5.1 sound and the Manchurian Candidate is an outstanding film.  The films however are United Artists films (purchased by the newly set up MGM company)so don't expect any of Sinatra's MGM classics from the 40's and early 50's except "Dolls".  The MGM classics are now owned by WB and can be found as Warner Bros titles - and at great prices too.
summary: SINATRA'S HITS BUT NOT HIS MGM ONES
Title: N/A
